location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.287 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter enclosing a translation of correspondence from the Native Agent at Sharjah Mullah Husain [MullƒÅ Husayn], dated 7 June 1850. Husayn reports on a truce of four months agreed between the Sultan of Muscat Syed Toweynee [Thuwaini bin Said] and the Governor of Sohar [Suhar] Syed Ges ben Azan.
